poem:
"Nightfall on Nightlife"

Small fond places, cornered and strangled,
Carcasses of light, trapped in red tape and rent.
A city stifles its own laughter,
Boots echo down drunken pews.
Music, once convivial, now case for contempt.
Night & Day, teetering on twilight's precipice,
Silenced rebellion, a muted chorus.
The city sleeps, dreams soured
With the bitter taste of quietened nights.
